This app demonstrates:

1. All core parameters of `navset_card_pill`:
   - `id`: For tracking the selected panel
   - `selected`: Setting the initially selected panel
   - `header`: Adding header content
   - `footer`: Adding footer content
   - `placement`: Controlling nav items placement

2. Different types of navigation panels:
   - Basic panels
   - Panel with an icon
   - Panel in a dropdown menu

3. The app shows:
   - Static content in each panel
   - Dynamic content using `@render.text`
   - Current selection tracking

The app is minimal and focuses specifically on demonstrating `navset_card_pill` functionality without unnecessary additional components.

To run this app:

1. Save it as `app.py`
2. Make sure you have Shiny for Python installed: `pip install shiny`
3. Run it with: `shiny run app.py`

Note: For the icon to work properly, you need to add Font Awesome CSS to your app. Add this line at the start of your app after the imports:

This provides a complete demonstration of `navset_card_pill` while keeping the app focused and minimal.
